channel.title: Changing the coords for teleporting
channel.description: im using deltascape source and i want to change the coords of the home in the teleporting spells. is this in the client.java or clickingmost.java? and what do i search for to change it?

item.title: Changing the coords for teleporting
item.dc:creator: @iownall14 iownall14
item.description:
@iownall14 wrote:

deltascape is basiclly a waste of time lol

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the coords for teleporting
item.dc:creator: @waffle1 waffle`
item.description:
@waffle1 wrote:

[quote=“my stoof, post:5, topic:258975”]there is no emote tab teles with deltascape…[quote author=waffle` link=topic=341975.msg2645029#msg2645029 date=1233167130]
I’m not sure if this will help since you’re using deltascape, never experianced with it so, try this though.

Are you trying to change it for ::home or for the emote tab teleport?

For the :: home one search for

 ("home")

You should find something LIKE this -

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { teleportToX = XXXX; teleportToY = XXXX; heightLevel = 0; sendMessage("You teleport to Home."); }

The XXXX is the coords that it teleports you to.

If you are trying to find the emote tab teleport look for something like this in your client.java

         case 9123

Something like this

        case 9123: // tabs
            teleportToX = XXXX;
            teleportToY = XXXX;
            sendMessage("You teleport to...Home");
            break;

Just change XXXX to your coords. I’m not sure if it is the same for your source but thats how it is in mine.

[/quote][/quote]

Really? Hmm, maybe I’ll have to mess around with delta-scape, sounds like something different from everything else I’ve used.

Read full topic

For the :: home one search for

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { teleportToX = XXXX; teleportToY = XXXX; heightLevel = 0; sendMessage("You teleport to Home."); }

item.title: Changing the coords for teleporting
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

Search for case 50235: In clickingmost.java
And under that you should see something like

c.triggerTele(3088+misc.random(3),3501+misc.random(3), 0) Chane 3088 and 3501 to the coords you want

Read full topic
